content.description: A battery or batteries connected to two parallel plates produce the equipotential lines between the plates shown above.
content.question: Which of the following configurations is most likely to produce these equipotential lines?

choices.label: A circuit diagram shows a 2 volt battery with its positive terminal on the left and the negative terminal on the right, connected to a capacitor in the series connection.
A circuit diagram shows two 2 volts batteries connected to two parallel plates. The positive terminals of the batteries are facing to the left and the negative terminals to the right.
A circuit diagram shows a 2 volts battery connected to two parallel plates. The positive terminals of the battery are facing to the right and the negative terminals to the left.
A circuit diagram shows two 2 volts batteries connected to two parallel plates. The positive terminals of the batteries are facing to the right and the negative terminals to the left.

A circuit diagram shows two 2 volts batteries connected to two parallel plates. The positive terminals of the batteries are connected to the two plates. The negative terminals are connected to each other.

content.answer: A circuit diagram shows two 2 volts batteries connected to two parallel plates. The positive terminals of the batteries are facing to the right and the negative terminals to the left.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
